note:
Project Gutenberg, founded in 1971, is the oldest producer and distributor of free ebooks.

According to Michael Hart (March 8, 1947 – September 6, 2011), founder of Project Gutenberg, the mission of Project Gutenberg is simple: to encourage the creation and distribution of eBooks.
This mission is, as much as possible, to encourage all those who are interested in making eBooks and helping to give them away.

I left Twitter and I'm rebuilding my digital community.
Environmental geneticist & outdoorswoman • into botany, evolution, space, sci-comm, skiing, Outlander, social justice • she/her • @kejames on Twitter

Ex-freelance anime/games journo. I adapt manga now. Queer bipolar, autistic cat person.  

Studying my 2nd MA (in Interdisciplinary Japanese Studies) at the UEA, my first is in Classics from the OU. My BA is in Theology and Religious Studies. I minored in Classics.   

Research areas: Shinto studies, Japanese horror, computer games, anime and manga, world mythology, modern paganism, Greek and Roman religious practices, cults and NRMs, modern religious studies and Japanese cultural studies.

I've lived in #PuertoRico off and on since 2004, and now own and live on a #coffee farm working on land tending #robotics and - very eventually - harvest.

note:
Providing charts of discussions.

Invoke me by replying to a toot with a single line saying "Calling @Chartodon". In the resulting chart you can click on a node to open the original post.

I may take a while to reply, depending on how busy I am, and how extensive the discussion.

Currently I'm being upgraded to take a parameter that changes the rendering, but that's still in progress. To see the status, reply to a post with this:

"Calling @Chartodon Help"
